avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There is usually not enough snow for snow sports and avalanches can hardly be triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lack of snow and stones are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is no closed snow cover, snowpack and the terrain is mostly bare.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, the mostly sunny mountain weather will continue with good visibility. High and medium-high cloud fields will pass over the peaks at times. The wind will blow weakly to moderately from the south. Temperatures at 2000 metres will be around 5 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Small avalanches in particular can occasionally be triggered by one person in shady slope high alpine regions above 2600 metres. This is where the older and fresh foehn drift snow has formed a suitable shelf above a weak layer (usually in persistent weak layer). In addition to the risk of burial, the risk of falling and injury should be taken into account.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rare avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layers of snow

snowpackStructure.comment: On the sunny slopes, the snow cover, snowpack is soaked up to high altitudes during the daytime changes. On the shady slope, it often remains hard-frozen on the surface, below which there is partly unbound edged snow at altitude, which can serve as a weak layer in exceptional cases. This is the case, for example, above the hard old snow from early winter. The snow depth is well below average at all altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, the mostly sunny mountain weather will continue with good visibility. High and medium-high cloud fields will pass over the peaks at times. The southerly wind will reach speeds of around 60 km/h. Temperatures at 2000 metres will be around 5 degrees, at 3000 metres around -2 degrees. The frost line is at around 2600 metres.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Only very rarely can drift snow packs be triggered by individuals in shady slopes, avalanches remain small. In areas adjacent to the ridgeline, crests or summits, there are isolated trigger points for mainly small avalanches that are difficult to disturb, even in persistent weak layers.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Injury from stones and falling are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow depth is well below average for the time of year, low to medium elevations and the sunny slopes are widely covered in snow. The snow cover, snowpack is soaked up to high altitudes on the sunny slopes during daytime changes and often remains frozen hard in the shade. At high altitudes on the shady slopes, weak layers of faceted crystals still remain in the snow cover, mostly in the vicinity of crusts.

weatherForecast.comment: The mostly sunny mountain weather with good visibility will continue on Sunday. High and medium-high cloud fields will pass over the peaks at times. The wind will blow weakly to moderately from the south, along the Tauern and on the peaks of the northern Alps also briskly (peaks around 50 to 60 km/h). Temperatures at 2000 metres will be around 5 degrees, at 3000 metres around -2 degrees.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: In high and high alpine, shady locations, isolated avalanche prone locations under the hard cover
